passage_text: Meaning & Origins. English: habitational name from Bewley Castle in the former county of Westmorland (now part of Cumbria), from Bewley in Durham, or from Beaulieu in Hampshire (see Beaulieu), all named with beu ‘lovely’ + lieu ‘place’. See more.
Recorded in the spellings of Beaulieu, Beuly, Beauley, Bewlay, Bewley and Bewlie, this is an Anglo-Irish surname, but of French origins.

Bewley Name Meaning. English: habitational name from Bewley Castle in the former county of Westmorland (now part of Cumbria), from Bewley in Durham, or from Beaulieu in Hampshire (see Beaulieu), all named with beu ‘lovely’ + lieu ‘place’.
